messages.content: What is the purpose of the LoRA Tag Loader custom node in ComfyUI?
The purpose of the LoRA Tag Loader custom node in ComfyUI is to read LoRA tag(s) from text and load it into the checkpoint model.
How should the LoRA tag be formatted in the positive prompt for the LoRA Tag Loader to extract it?
The LoRA tag should be formatted as "<lora:CroissantStyle:0.8>" in the positive prompt for the LoRA Tag Loader to extract it.
What does the LoRA Tag Loader do with the extracted LoRA tag in the output STRING?
The LoRA Tag Loader strips the LoRA tag(s) from the output STRING, which can then be forwarded to the CLIP Text Encoder.
What happens when an extra weight is added to the LoRA tag in the format "<lora:CroissantStyle:0.8:0.7>"?
When an extra weight is added to the LoRA tag in the format "<lora:CroissantStyle:0.8:0.7>", it patches the unet with 0.8 and patches the text encoder with 0.7.
What is the purpose of adding an extra weight to the LoRA tag in the LoRA Tag Loader?
The purpose of adding an extra weight to the LoRA tag in the LoRA Tag Loader is to pass it as the equivalent of strength_clip in Lora Loader.
How can the LoRA Tag Loader custom node be installed in ComfyUI?
To install the LoRA Tag Loader custom node in ComfyUI, drop the "comfyui_lora_tag_loader" folder into the "...\ComfyUI\ComfyUI\custom_nodes" directory and restart the UI.
What is the relationship between the extra weight in the LoRA tag and the strength_clip in Lora Loader?
The extra weight in the LoRA tag is passed as the equivalent of strength_clip in Lora Loader.
